description: From the Old French vertible, from Latin vertibilis from the stem of vertō (“I turn”).

adjectives.description: vertible (comparative more vertible, superlative most vertible)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Able to turn or to be turned; changeable. [15th–17th CC.]
examples: But were it not better that God Almighty should annihilate the Individuals of this middle vertible Order, as you call it, as soon as they lapse into Sin?
